answerText: Look Back in Anger [10] Look Back in Anger is a play by this English playwright and member of the Angry Young Men who created the self-hating William Maitland in Inadmissable Evidence.
heading: ACF Regionals  |2012 | Maryland B + Loyola  | 10 | Literature | British | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: One unseen character in this play is Webster, who reminds the protagonist of his old love interest Madeline. For ten points each: [10] Name this play that sees Jimmy Porter have a falling out with his wife Alison, who loses her baby.
